thread.title: NRL grand final record-breaking ratings smash the AFL's grand final efforts
thread.title_full: NRL grand final record-breaking ratings smash the AFL's grand final efforts

author: Ebony Bowden
title: NRL grand final record-breaking ratings smash the AFL's grand final efforts
text:
Click to play video Return to video Video settings Please Log in to update your video settings
Video will begin in 5 seconds.
Don't play Play now More video Recommended Replay video Return to video Video settings Please Log in to update your video settings
Jimmy Barnes' NRL grand final pants Cold Chisel kicked off the NRL showdown with a cracker of a performance but some fans were left confused by the lead singer's choice of attire. 
PT0M39S http://www.canberratimes.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-43vek 620 349 October 5, 2015 - 7:44AM Autoplay On Off Video feedback Video settings Jimmy Barnes and Jessica Mauboy shame the AFL Bryan Adams told to be better than Meat Loaf Kate Ceberano forgets national anthem lyrics at AFL grand final ​ The NRL grand final had many things the AFL grand final didn't: Jimmy Barnes, nationwide appeal, and in the end, way more viewers.
Both 2015 seasons culminated in glitzy grand finals over the weekend and despite the AFL's big name international acts, it was rugby league that smashed it out of the park.
Cowboys captain Johnathan Thurston poses with the Premiership trophy after winning the 2015 NRL Grand Final. Photo: Cameron Spencer 
At its peak, a whopping 4.4 million people tuned in to the NRL grand final between the Brisbane Broncos and North Queensland Cowboys on Sunday night - a new record for the league.
Advertisement The figure is almost half a million higher than Saturday afternoon's clash between the West Coast Eagles and Hawthorn which peaked at 3.9 million.
The average ratings for the two games were a lot closer however, as the AFL match-up averaged 3.5 million viewers compared to the NRL's 3.6 million.
Hawks celebrate winning the 2015 grand final. Photo: Getty Images 
The Cowboys beat the Broncos in a nail-biting 17-16 finish at Sydney's Olympic Stadium, with many commentators hailing it as the best NRL grand final of all time.
Saturday's AFL game was a lot less thrilling as an unstoppable Hawthorn thrashed West Coast 107-61 in a repeat of last year's lacklustre grand final.
The NRL entertainment also finished on top of the AFL's big name international acts.
Goulding says she loves it when people think she lip-syncs, because it is "a rad compliment". Photo: Scott Barbour 
While the AFL continued its bemoaned tradition of importing musicians - hiring Chris Isaak, British singer Ellie Goulding and Bryan Adams - it was the NRL's local performances which won plaudits .
As Goulding had to defend herself against claims of lip syncing following an erroneously-timed backing track, over at Olympic Park, Jimmy Barnes, Cold Chisel and Jessica Mauboy exceeded expectations.
The 2015 AFL grand final ratings were down from last year, where a peak of 4.2 million people tuned in to watch Hawthorn thump Sydney.
Jimmy Barnes of Cold Chisel performs ahead of the 2015 NRL Grand Final match between the Brisbane Broncos and the North Queensland Cowboys. Photo: Brett Hemmings 
Sorry @AFL , the #NRLGF wins the entertainment stakes. @coldchisel 
— Michael Rowland (@mjrowland68) October 4, 2015
